Field.Name: CAN'T USE#set me!! me!!! i do something cool!!! you'll be happy forever if there this tag reference is filled in! don't believe the lies!!! LIESSSS!!!!!!!! YESS, MY PRECIOUSSSSS, LIESSSS...

Fields.Field0: cortana hack#sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry
Fields.Field1: use demo UI#uses alternate UI collection for demo

Fields.Field0: scripted#the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.
Fields.Field1: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
Fields.Field3: always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

Field.Name: period:seconds#this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)
scale period by#multiply this function by the above period
scale function by#multiply this function by the result of the above function
wobble function#the curve used for the wobble
wobble period:seconds#the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble
wobble magnitude:percent#the amount of random wobble in the magnitude
square wave threshold#if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.
step count#the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)
sawtooth count#the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0
scale result by#multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math
bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
multiplayer team index#on a multiplayer map, this determines which team the vehicle belongs to for custom vehicle sets.

Fields.Field0: slayer default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a slayer game
Fields.Field1: ctf default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a ctf game
Fields.Field2: king default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a king game
Fields.Field3: oddball default#vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a oddball game
Fields.Field8: slayer allowed#vehicle can spawn in a slayer game
Fields.Field9: ctf allowed#vehicle can spawn in a ctf game
Fields.Field10: king allowed#vehicle can spawn in a king game
Fields.Field11: oddball allowed#vehicle can spawn in a oddball game

Field.Name: desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"
desired permutation#if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

manual bsp index#structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)
respawn delay:seconds#delay between respawning actors in this encounter
initial state#state that this actor starts in
return state#state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do
unique leader type#what kind of leader this squad has (e.g. a sarge for marines) - 'normal' is based on the size of the squad, 'random' always creates a leader, or you can specify an individual type
normal diff count#initial number of actors on normal difficulty
insane diff count#initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)
respawn min actors#minimum number of actors alive at once (will spawn instantly if less than this number)
respawn max actors#maximum number of actors alive at once (never spawns above this number)
respawn total#total number to respawn (zero = infinite)
respawn delay:seconds#delay between respawning actors in this squad
sequence ID#identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence)
sequence ID#which move position sequence we can use (zero = no specific sequences)
return state#state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do
initial state#state that this actor starts in

Fields.Field0: allow initiative#lets an actor decide to stop following its commands and attack an enemy
Fields.Field1: allow targeting#lets an actor shoot at enemies while following its commands
Fields.Field2: disable looking#stops an actor from turning, stopping or looking around in response to stimuli received while following its commands
Fields.Field3: disable communication#stops an actor from communicating while following its commands
Fields.Field4: disable falling damage#makes an actor not take any damage from falling while following its commands
Fields.Field5: manual bsp index#set if the command list is manually attached to a specific bsp

Field.Name: manual bsp index#structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)
animation graph#leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

Fields.Field0: stop if death#this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies
Fields.Field1: stop if damaged#an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged
Fields.Field2: stop if visible enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy
Fields.Field3: stop if alerted to enemy#an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy
Fields.Field4: player must be visible#this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player
Fields.Field5: stop other actions#participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation
Fields.Field6: keep trying to play#if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play
Fields.Field7: player must be looking#this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

Field.Name: trigger distance:world units#distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger
run-to-player dist:world units#if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

Fields.Field0: optional#the conversation can continue even if nobody for this participant was found
Fields.Field1: has alternate#if nobody for this participant can be found, we use a participant marked as 'is alternate' instead, e.g. someone from over the radio
Fields.Field2: is alternate#this participant is only used if some participant in this conversation was marked as 'has alternate' could not be found

Field.Name: use this object#if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation
set new name#once we pick a unit, we name it this

Fields.Field3: wait after until told to advance

Field.Name: addressee participant#this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'
